medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and multiple episodes of non-bilious non-bloody vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient had an initial onset of symptoms approximately 2 days prior with abdominal pain and vomiting, which resolved spontaneously. Symptoms reappeared last night with emesis and right lower quadrant abdominal pain. The patient associates this episode with her usual Crohn's disease flare.
